pageContext.desc: An art teacher and amateur anthropologist on his studies of Iroquois artifacts.
transcription:
[du] INTRODUCTION. [/du]
The Subject Chosen has a wide range, to attempt to embrace it fully would not be possible in the alloted space. I will therefore pass lightly over the history of the IROQOIS_ and then endeavour to describe their [u] RELIGION, OLD and NEW,[/u] and their [u] FEASTS, MASK DANCES, MEDICINE MAKING,[/u] and CEREMONIES which are connected with [u] their RELIGION. [/u]
[all text beyond this is actually on the following page]

2
THE IROQUOIS
occupied the Valleys & Uplands of Northern NEW YORK from the Hudson river to LAKE ERIE early in the 16th Centuary when the White people first came. They consisted of FIVE TRIBES or NATIONS (as they called themselves).
The MOHAWKS- or CANIENGAS as they should }
properly be called}
" ONONDAGAS
" CAYUGAS and the SENECAS.
Their Origin or from whence they came? no one knows, we only know that they were here when the first white people came. 
It was soon found that they were a  United  people that they had a COMPACT or GOVERNMENT__ which Compact we now know was formed six generations before the coming of the white race. Later __ in 1714 __ the TUSCARORAS joined the LEAGUE _ after_ they joined they were called the SIX-NATIONS.
	They dwelt in the State of NEW YORK but they had Conquered & exercised dominion over many others_ even in the then far west beyond the MISSISIPPI RIVER and in CANADA.
	They were SUPERSITCOUS [DEITIES has been erased] believed in WITCHCRAFT_ DREMS in DEMONS_ and had many DIETIES or GODS --that is now called "the

3
The ANCIENT RELIGION of the IROQUOIS.
It was the custom about 1642 to make a public solemnity in February_ when the DEMONS were all honored on the same day. 
They called this celebration
ONON-HONA-ROIA, or the "turning of the head" because all the youths & even the women & children ran about like madmen, claiming that one should obey the demons, by making a present to them of a thing which they put as a riddle, & which has been dictated to them in a dream.
	This dream feast was a Saturnalia of unrestrained jollity & dissoluteness to which the burning of the WHITE DOG was later added, but is not now practiced.
	Dreams are still believed and told, but the false faces - or masks are the only traces of their ancient follies. The Missionaries failed in banishing this custom = it is described again at ONONDAGA in 1671_" (Quotation) "THEY have a certain ceremony, the most distinguished among their supersticious customs, which they practice once a year, in February with great solemnity in favor of their dreams, by which they claim to know the will of a certain TAR-ON-HIA-WA-GON
